to get involved with cube flow community so the cube flow mission statement is a
place that i like to start from kubeflow is designed to make it easy for
everyone to develop deploy and manage a portable distributed
and scalable ml system on kubeflow on kubernetes
so that's a mouthful let's try to break that down a bit develop deploy and manage you can think
of that as i want to be able to develop a machine learning model in my jupiter notebook
and then i'd like to be able to train tune and deploy that into production and have the tools to
manage it the ability to have it portable distributed and scalable
portable meaning that i may want to have the same environment be able to work on my laptop
on-prem in a larger cluster and then also in a public cloud
environment distributed inside of machine learning
at times you're going to want to use your infrastructure as effectively as possible so you may
have multiple nodes you may have different capabilities on those nodes where you have gpus or cpus of lots of ram
you want to make sure that you're placing your workloads appropriately in a distributed way and then finally scalable
where you may want to scale down to a single node or up to hundreds or even thousands of
gpus or cpus as well as gigabytes of storage or
or lots of ram as well petabytes of storage actually uh and then an ml system on kubernetes
so the important thing there is the ability to use kubernetes effectively in the
declarative operations which allow you to leverage your infrastructure
effectively at its higher utilization as well as to minimize the operational
overhead for the people that are managed that infrastructure so this is the same mission that we've
had since 2017 and we continue to deliver on it through the last
11 releases qflo is a collection of many different
software components that allow you to build train and deploy
a model let's walk through some of those components first you have the jupiter notebook
which provides that ide experience that is an interactive
tool that allows you to teach and share your work effectively many people really like
jupiter notebooks uh one thing that's special about kubeflow jupiter notebooks is that they
are you you do have isolation for them and authentication
so users are separated from each other or they could share the same kubernetes name space
so you get the best of both worlds there when it comes to isolation and authentication training
operators are important because inside of your ml training algorithms
such as tensorflow pi torch or xgboost or mxnet you will have the ml layer the
machine learning layer that has masters or workers or parameter servers and workers
those have to be mapped into kubernetes master workers and since any of those can be
moving at any one time any of the workers could be moving per kubernetes
you need an operator a kubernetes crd basically that will uh move those workloads to the
appropriate place at the appropriate time those are all delivered as part of kubeflow and it really does allow you to
have distributed training which speeds up your model processing time
uh workflow building these are tools that allow you to simplify the way
that you build a q-flow pipeline and deploy it and run it so typically in a q-flo pipeline you
have to build a uh a containerized step for every pipeline step and then you
have to write some qflo dsl domain specific language to run those those containers
in the appropriate order kale and fairing basically simplify that
process for you and make it go very uh much faster saving the data scientists quite a bit
of time cubefold pipelines is a way to schedule run and monitor
uh a workflow that will run your machine learning model so
from time to time you're going to have your machine learning model and it will be receiving either new code
or new data and rather than building it again by hand it's good to have a workflow that does
that for you qfl pipelines does that for you uh and then allows you to schedule how
that's run to to run it and then monitor effectively data management is below the container
storage interface on um kubeflow pipe on and below qflow
but it does provide the versioning the sharing and the reproducibility
that all have been very popular and a basic field building block in order to do data
science you need to have a good data management layer the tools involved the hyperparameter
tuning the hp tuning the tensorboard and the prometheus
give you tuning allows you to take those hyperparameters and
adjust them appropriately automatically through a series of algorithms uh which saves you a bunch of
time and makes your your your model run faster and more efficiently and more
accurately tensorboard gives you a visual visualization of your data and your code
uh and then prometheus allows you to have that infrastructure monitoring that allows you to
better serve uh the at the software layer below the machine learning layer the
metadata very important layer that allows you to keep
the artifacts and the parameters that are outside of the code the ml code and the data in a way that
you can then reproduce your model and understand what's necessary to to have that model
uh capable for you in in a future time or reproducible in a future time
and then finally kf serving uh these serving tools which we have three here kf
serving seldom core and tf serving allow you to put your model
uh into production consistently and efficiently seldom core and tf serving are the much
more mature serving components kf serving or kubeflow serving
is working uh to provide a simple interface for model serving and provide with as
few as seven lines of yaml uh you to deploy your model
and it's designed to provide a similar experience whether you're using tensorflow or pi
torch or psychic learn or xgboost or others kf serving is
built on top of istio and k-native so that you can start with a simple configuration and add advanced security
and load balancing kf serving is designed from the ground up to speed model introduction
with a b testing canaries and auto scaling the the kubeflow
serving components are designed to leverage kubernetes efficiently to utilize infrastructure resources and
declarative operations to minimize your manual operations so that's a quick look at the components
inside of kubeflow let's continue down our path and look at what happened with kubeflow 1.0

cd the documentation ownership and maintenance as well as user adoption so
